TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 1086
TEI.2.document_title: Samuel M Williams to James F Perry, 09-03-1834

barker_notes.barker_summary: Samuel M. Williams to James F. Perry, September 3, 1834. Copy of letter from Austin.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1086

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Samuel M. Williams to James F. Perry, September 3, 1834. Copy of letter from Austin.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Mouth of Brasos*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="09-03-1834">3d Septemr. 1834*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir.*/p*
*p*I enclose for your perusal and the satisfaction of *person_mentioned*Mrs. Perry*/person_mentioned* the last letter that I have recd from our friend *person_mentioned*Col Austin*/person_mentioned*. I wrote to him from *location_mentioned*Orleans */location_mentioned*and further authorized him to draw on *person_mentioned*Beers, St John and Co*/person_mentioned* for 1,000$ which will last him until we can hear further from him.*/p*
*p*I leave here in the steam boat for *location_mentioned*Columbia*/location_mentioned*. If I had made my journey by Land should have done myself the pleasure of calling on you. I am very anxious to get home and am with esteem yr friend*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Samuel M Williams */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Mr. James F Perry */person_mentioned* At *location_mentioned*home*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
